did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle:
Tompkins County anti-slavery items,
1834-1848.
did.physdesc: Petitions, tax schedules, and photocopies of articles.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Petitions to Congress from inhabitants of Tompkins County concerning abolition of slavery in Washington, DC, the annexation of Texas, and other anti-slavery issues, 1836-1845; tax schedules, and photocopies of articles from the Ithaca Chronicle, Ithaca Journal, Trumansburg Advertiser, and The Flag, containing speeches, letters, essays, election results and reports of anti-slavery and Free Soil meetings.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p:
Petitions to Congress from inhabitants of Tompkins County concerning abolition of slavery in Washington, DC, the annexation of Texas, and other anti-slavery issues, 1836-1845; tax schedules, and photocopies of articles from the
Ithaca Chronicle, Ithaca Journal, Trumansburg Advertiser, and The Flag, containing speeches, letters, essays, election results and reports of anti-slavery and Free Soil meetings.

1. Texas not be admitted into the Union

3. Right of petitioning not be enjoyed
4. No state be admitted into Union that allows slavery
